page.title: Inflation and Its Effect on Currency & Crypto

overview.title: Overview
bullets: Inflation is the pace at which the general price level rises, eroding purchasing power over time.
Central banks monitor inflation closely because persistent overshoots can disrupt stability and force policy changes.
For traders and investors, inflation’s impact on interest rates, currency strength, and asset returns is a core macro driver.

cpi.label: Consumer Price Index (CPI)
cpi.text: Measures the average change in prices for a basket of consumer goods and services; the most watched inflation gauge.

ppi.label: Producer Price Index (PPI)
ppi.text: Tracks prices at the producer level; rising input costs can foreshadow consumer inflation.

demandPull.label: Demand-Pull Inflation
demandPull.text: Occurs when demand outstrips supply, pushing prices higher.

costPush.label: Cost-Push Inflation
costPush.text: Results from rising production costs (wages, materials) passed on to consumers.

currencyStrength.title: 1. Currency Strength
bullets: High inflation can weaken a currency by eroding real value and investor confidence.
Aggressive rate hikes to fight inflation can attract yield-seeking capital and support the currency.

ratePolicy.title: 2. Interest Rate Policy
bullets: When inflation rises, central banks often lift policy rates, increasing currency appeal via higher yields.
Low inflation (or disinflation) can prompt rate cuts to stimulate demand, which may weigh on FX.

hedge.title: 1. ‘Inflation Hedge’ Perception
bullets: Bitcoin and some digital assets are perceived as hedges due to fixed or programmatic supply.
During fiat erosion episodes, some investors rotate toward crypto seeking value preservation.

volatility.title: 2. Volatility and Speculation
bullets: Crypto’s inherent volatility can be magnified by inflation-driven flows and narrative shifts.
Participants may split between long-term hedge positioning and short-term speculative trading.

items.label: Employment & Wages

benefits.title: Benefits of Understanding Inflation
bullets: Improves currency valuation and rate-path expectations.
Supports portfolio construction across fiat and crypto exposures.
Deepens macro awareness of policy cycles and cross-asset impacts.

limitations.title: Limitations
bullets: Lagging nature: headline gauges like CPI can reflect past conditions.
Global spillovers: imported inflation and external shocks complicate reads.
Event risk: inflation prints and guidance can spark abrupt, whipsaw reactions—especially in crypto.
